program_related_info.epd_owner_liability: The EPD owner has the sole ownership, liability, and responsibility for the EPD.
program_related_info.comparability_note: EPDs within the same product category but from different programmes may not be comparable. EPDs of construction products may not be comparable if they do not comply with EN 15804.

product_description.product_use: Cementitious product for construction in New Zealand

materials.name: Ground granulated blast furnace slag
materials.allocation_method: Economic allocation based on significant economic value at point of collection

product_description.packaging: Delivered in either bulk or packaging
product_standard_references: PCR 2019:14 Construction Products and Construction Services

lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to gate with distribution - module A4 option)

background_data: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.39) (2022)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight of cement for intermediate flows; economic allocation for ground granulated blast furnace slag
allocation.notes: Allocation approach of AusLCI LCA database adopted as default for secondary data and processes

lca_information.cut_off_criteria: No flows excluded on basis of cut-off criteria

data_quality.foreground_data: Medium or higher for geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data: Updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

lca_information.system_boundaries: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A4); excludes life cycle stages beyond Holcim's gate; excludes personnel, infrastructure and production equipment not directly consumed

transport_and_installation.transport_description: Ship cement unloading and loading included in system diagram; distribution included in cradle to gate scope

end_of_life.description: Life cycle stages beyond Holcim's gate are excluded from the LCA

carbon_emission_context.background: In New Zealand, over 1.5 million tonnes of traditional cement is used annually, generating approximately 1.23 million tonnes of CO2 emissions
carbon_emission_context.commitment: Aotearoa committed to net zero by 2050
carbon_emission_context.company_strategy: Holcim NZ is building progress for a lower carbon footprint with low carbon, high-performance, and specialty cement and cement binders
carbon_emission_context.global_strategy: Holcim's 2030 and 2050 net-zero targets validated by Science Based Targets initiative

fly_ash.treatment: Treated as waste material in AusLCI process, only transport impacts included

ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag.allocation: Economic allocation based on significant economic value at point of collection

recycled_materials_handling.allocation_approach: AusLCI dataset allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes, conforming to EN 15804
